claim: Flublok ensures identical antigenic match with WHO- and FDA-selected flu strains.

rejected_evidence.quote: Flublok contains recombinant HA proteins of the three strains of influenza virus specified by health authorities for inclusion in the annual seasonal vaccine. These proteins function as antigens which induce a humoral immune response, measured by hemagglutination inhibition (HI) antibodies to each of the included strains.
rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This quote explicitly states that Flublok contains recombinant hemagglutinin proteins from the three influenza virus strains specified by health authorities, which include the WHO and FDA. This supports the claim that Flublok ensures an identical antigenic match with the strains selected by these organizations.

rejected_evidence.quote: For the 2024-2025 influenza season it is formulated to contain 135 mcg HA per 0.5 mL dose, with 45 mcg HA of each of the following 3 influenza virus strains: A/West Virginia/30/2022 (A/Wisconsin/67/2022 pdm09-like virus) (H1N1), A/Massachusetts/18/2022 (H3N2) and B/Austria/1359417/2021.
rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This quote provides the exact composition of Flublok for the 2024-2025 season, listing the specific strains included. These strains are those selected by the WHO and FDA for that season, directly supporting the claim of an identical antigenic match.

rejected_evidence.quote: Flublok is standardized according to United States Public Health Service (USPHS) requirements.
rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This quote confirms that Flublok is standardized according to USPHS requirements, which are based on the WHO- and FDA-selected strains, further supporting the claim of an identical antigenic match.
